body_html:
We tried changing the number of threads, but this didn't solve the issue. Moreover, it seems that setNumThreads method has absolutely no affect on TF Lite's performance - for values of 1, 2, 4, 8, 100 and 1000 the results were identical (up to several ms).

Here is more information regarding the performance of TF Mobile, TF Lite and TF Lite + NNAPI. We've just tested SRCNN (image deblurring, 200x200px) and VGG-19 (image super-res, 192x192px) networks on two devices - Nexus 5X with Android 8.1 and Razer Phone with Android 7.1, below are the results:

Nexus 5X, TF Mobile: SRCNN - 0.8s, VGG-19 - 4.5s
Nexus 5X, TF Lite: SRCNN - 1.8s, VGG-19 - 8s
Nexus 5X, TF Lite + NNAPI: SRCNN - 2.7s, VGG-19 - 15.7s

Razer Phone, TF Mobile: SRCNN - 0.36s, VGG-19 - 1.8s
Razer Phone, TF Lite: SRCNN - 0.71s, VGG-19 - 3.3s

As mentioned before, changing the number of threads didn't lead to any improvements.

body:
We tried changing the number of threads, but this didn't solve the issue. Moreover, it seems that setNumThreads method has absolutely no affect on TF Lite's performance - for values of 1, 2, 4, 8, 100 and 1000 the results were identical (up to several ms).

Here is more information regarding the performance of TF Mobile, TF Lite and TF Lite + NNAPI. We've just tested SRCNN (image deblurring, 200x200px) and VGG-19 (image super-res, 192x192px) networks on two devices - Nexus 5X with Android 8.1 and Razer Phone with Android 7.1, below are the results:

Nexus 5X, TF Mobile: SRCNN - 0.8s, VGG-19 - 4.5s
Nexus 5X, TF Lite: SRCNN - 1.8s, VGG-19 - 8s
Nexus 5X, TF Lite + NNAPI: SRCNN - 2.7s, VGG-19 - 15.7s

Razer Phone, TF Mobile: SRCNN - 0.36s, VGG-19 - 1.8s
Razer Phone, TF Lite: SRCNN - 0.71s, VGG-19 - 3.3s

As mentioned before, changing the number of threads didn't lead to any improvements.
